main_definition: Having received a formal education or being knowledgeable in various subjects.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Informed or well-read, with broad general knowledge about the world and its cultures. Example: An educated person might appreciate fine arts from different countries.
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite not having a formal degree, her extensive travels had made her an educated individual in various cultural aspects.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having received academic training and degrees, usually at tertiary level. Example: He was highly educated with multiple advanced degrees.
meanings_and_examples.example: Her PhD in Physics from a prestigious university made her an educated professional in the field.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refined or cultured in behavior and manners, often as a result of formal education. Example: At social gatherings, his educated demeanor and etiquette were noticeable.
meanings_and_examples.example: She attended many schools for her early childhood education which contributed to her well-mannered and educated manner.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Able to think critically and make reasoned judgments. Example: An educated person can analyze complex issues with a critical eye.
meanings_and_examples.example: His ability to dissect arguments and understand nuanced topics is indicative of his educated mind.
